Doom, the landmark videogame that electrified a generation, leaps from the computer screen to the big screen as a terrifying sci-fi horror action adventure, transporting audiences to a dark and disturbing future with all the visceral excitement and horror that made its gaming predecessor a global phenomenon. (Universal)
Follows the hilarious exploits of the dedicated but hapless young Canadian Mountie (Frasier). (Universal Pictures)

Ed the chimpanzee is more than just a mascot for the Santa Rosa Rockets -- he's actually talented enough to play third base. But when the team starts winning, Ed is kidnapped. Ed's fans and teammates are dismayed, but most devastated of all is Ed's "roommate," a pitcher (Matt LeBlanc) who gets cold feet when he plays but is learning to overcome it with the chimp's help. Will they ever get Ed back? (RottenTomatoes)

Satire. Four troubled orphans from four separate movie scenario's who are bind together in a wacky chocolate factory after receiving golden tickets to go on an 'epic adventure.' After they escape from the clutches of a very scary Willy Wonka they discover the magical world of 'Gnarnia' through an enchanted wardrobe. There they must seek the help of a randy lion, a hoard of mutants from the x academy, students of witchcraft and wizardry, funky swash-buckling pirates and a mischievous beaver to defeat the evil white bitch! A movie of Epic Proportions indeed! (imdb)

Combining the martial arts prowess of international action superstar Jackie Chan with state-of-the-art special effects, this action comedy stars Chan as Eddie Yang, a resolute Hong Kong cop who suffers a near fatal accident while investigating a case involving a mysterious medallion. (Sony Pictures)
A group of martial arts warriors have only six days to save the Earth from an extra-dimensional invasion (imdb)

film.filmname: The Scorpion King 2: Rise of a Warrior (2008)
film.summary: When young Mathayus witnesses his father's death in the hands of the king, his quest for vengeance transforms him into the most feared warrior of the ancient world. (imdb)
A computer hacker breaks into the computer system of the Seaborn Legend cruise liner and sets it speeding on a collision course into a gigantic oil tanker. (imdb)
Col. Guile and various other martial arts heroes fight against the tyranny of Dictator M. Bison and his cohorts. (imdb)

Facing another Christmas alone, Drew Latham (Affleck) decides to go back to his idyllic childhood home to recall the family holidays of his youth. There is, however, one problem: the people living there now are not Drew&#039;s family. (DreamWorks)

Jennifer Lopez plays San Francisco&#039;s most successful supplier of romance and glamour. She knows all the tricks. She knows all the rules. But then she breaks the most important rule of all: she falls in love with the groom, Matthew McConaughey. (Sony Pictures Entertainment)

A hundred miles away from the scene of a grizzly murder in small town American, Jill Johnson (Belle) settles in for a routine night of babysitting. With the children sound asleep and a beautiful home to explore, she locks the door and sets the alarm. But when a series of eerie phone calls from a stranger insists that she "check the children," Jill panics. Fear escalates to terror when she has the calls traced. And what the police find turns the perfect babysitting job into a 16-year-old's worst nightmare. (Screen Gems)
A former superhero (Allen) is called back into service to transform an group of ragtag kids into new heroes at a private academy. (Sony)
BloodRayne takes you to another place and time to experience a world where good and evil battle it out -- with mankind as the very prize. (Romar Entertainment)

The fourth installment of The Crow series, Luc Crash, the leader of a satanic gang of bikers murder a young man named Jimmy Cuervo and his girlfriend Lily for the purpose of a ritual to make Crash an immortal demon. Cuervo rises from the dead with the power of the crow to avenge his girlfriend&#039;s death, and to stop the completion of the ritual. (imdb)
The story of a professional basketball player who blows his career but gets a chance to bounce back by trading his jock strap for a sports bra. (Warner Bros.)
film.quote:
This. Stuff like... Gawdawful... Why?
Another movie that could be reduced to a five minute comedy sketch... Or maybe it was stretched from a five minute comedy sketch? Unnecessary and offensive (not because of any sexism, but offensive to the brain).

film.filmname: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector (2006)
film.summary: Sporting a cut-off flannel shirt and armed with a truck-load of one-liners, Larry the Cable Guy is America&#039;s reigning king of blue-collar comedy. Larry makes his feature film debut as a big city health inspector whose life is turned upside-down when he&#039;s saddled with a straight-arrow rookie partner and assigned the biggest case of his career. (Lionsgate)

MVP 2 opens with the lovable Jack being ousted from his hockey team, the Seattle Simians, and having to hit the road after being falsely accused of league misconduct. Jack ends up in the city, where he&#039;s befriended by Ben, a homeless skateboarder, and Ollie, a skate shop owner. (imdb)

Norbit (Murphy) has never had it easy. As a baby, he was abandoned on the steps of a Chinese restaurant/orphanage and raised by Mr. Wong (Murphy). Things get worse when he&#039;s forced into marriage by the mean, junk food-chugging queen, Rasputia (Murphy). Just when Norbit&#039;s hanging by his last thread, his childhood sweetheart, Kate (Newton), moves back to town. In the comedy "Norbit", he&#039;ll show them all that nice guys sometimes finish first. (DreamWorks Pictures)

Santa is allergic to cats, so he has a policy against delivering them as gifts, but little Tommy has been SO good, and all he wants is one small kitty. Santa says OK, but instead of one, the whole litter climbs into the sack. When Santa has a major allergic reaction, the kittens have to take over and deliver the presents on time. (imdb)
film.quote: 1 point for the fact that Santa has to get dramatically injected with a syringe to combat his allergic reaction to the kittens.

film.summary: The film continues the story of Sara (now being played by Izabella Miko) who goes on to be a student at Juilliard. As she excels to star pupil status, Sara becomes torn between her love for traditional ballet and her passion for the urban street rhythms of hip-hop, complicated further by her new love, hip-hop musician Miles... (Wikipedia)

The film follows the Spice Girls and their entourage (mostly fictional characters) - manager Clifford, his assistant Deborah, filmmaker Piers (who is trying to shoot a documentary on "the real Spice Girls") and others in their everyday life. (imdb)
film.quote: BuuuhhhHuuuhhhh

film.summary: Who's Your Caddy? is a hilarious fish out of water comedy about rap mogul C-Note from Atlanta who tries to join a genteel country club in the Carolinas but runs into fierce opposition from the Club's board. Undeterred, C-Note gets the brilliant idea to buy the land adjacent to the 17th hole which he leverages to attain membership... (The Weinstein Company)
Rayne, the half-human/half-vampire warrior, ventures to America's 1880's Wild West to stop the vampired Billy the Kid and his posse of vampire cowboys. (IMDB)

Kevin McCallister&#039;s parents have split up. Now living with his mom, he decides to spend Christmas with his dad at the mansion of his father&#039;s rich girlfriend, Natalie. Meanwhile robber Marv Merchants, one of the villains from the first two movies, partners up with a new criminal named Vera to hit Natalie&#039;s mansion. (imdb)
film.quote: At least 'Home Alone 3' had the decency to have a completely different character and unrelated events from the first two films. Was it good? No, but it wasn't a complete abortion of the franchise either. Apparently this was supposed to launch a TV series, which thankfully never saw light. Ugh. Why/How would Kevin be the same age?! Also French Stewart is worthless in movies. He is supposed to be Marv, originally played by Daniel Stern who turned down the reprise and called it "an insult."

film.filmname: I Still Know What You Did Last Summer (1998)
film.summary: The screamer sequel to the blood-chilling box office hit &#034;I Know What You Did Last Summer.&#034; (Sony)

On the outskirts of Riverton, "The Safest City in America", a pensive Inspector Gadget sits in his Gadgetmobile, along with his canine companion, Brain. Gadget is back on the job, on stakeout, but he is concerned that everything is too quiet in Riverton. He has a very simple, rational answer to this; " it&#039;s always the most quiet just before criminals strike"... (imdb)
film.quote: No... You can't be serious. French Stewart takes the place of Matthew Broderick in a sequel to a movie that was horrible to begin with? I don't think I need to say any more.

film.summary: Steven finds that his new hockey team, the Nelson Nuggets, are a bunch of dispirited losers who'd rather fight than play the game. However, everything changes for the better when he comes across a highly communicative chimp named Jack who not only knows sign language, but also has one helluva slap shot.
film.quote:
How do movies like this get green-lighted? I mean, honestly, who thinks sports movies starring animals are a good idea?
At least with the Air Bud franchise you have some cute puppies who eventually start talking.

film.summary: A decade after the legendary Mask of Loki wreaked havoc on the life of an unsuspecting adult, the magical mask finds its way into the possession of a child in the family comedy Son of the Mask. (New Line Cinema)

The adventure continues with a new generation of talking toddlers. This time, the baby geniuses find themselves at the center of a nefarious scheme led by powerful media mogul Bill Biscane (Voight) to use his state-of-the-art satellite system to control the minds of the world&#039;s population. (Sony)
A new fable for the hip hop age, where the best street dancers pit their moves and their passion for a chance to turn their talent into their dreams. (Screen Gems)
film.quote: I contemplated giving this a couple of points because it resulted in a great episode of South Park... but then I realized that insightful spoof just furthered my opinion of how shitty this movie is. Leave the street dancing for the 3 minute music videos unless you can SOMEHOW come up with a decent plot with a little bit of realism to make us care about the characters and their backgrounds.
